title: 5 can’t-miss restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston this week
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Capricho Colombian Steakhouse is opening in Brookline, offering wood-grilled cuts and live music, pending liquor licenses.
Elephantine Bakery expands to Boston Seaport, featuring French-inspired pastries with Mediterranean influence, now in soft opening.
Mai, a French-Japanese izakaya in the Seaport, attracts attention with hand rolls and unique cocktails, currently walk-ins only.

title: Do the Bruins have a potential breakout prospect in camp in Dans Locmelis?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Dans Locmelis, a Bruins prospect, impressed at the 2025 IIHF World Championships with four goals and six points over seven games.
Locmelis, a 2022 fourth-round pick, excelled in the AHL with Providence, recording 12 points in six games during Calder Cup playoffs.
He aims to secure a spot on the Bruins roster; praised for his hockey IQ and ability to adapt quickly to professional levels.

title: Rob Gronkowski: Patriots QB Drake Maye looked ‘timid’ against Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rob Gronkowski criticized Patriots QB Drake Maye as 'timid' after their 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Patriots struggled with special teams and defense, allowing nine 20+ yard plays to Raiders QB Geno Smith.
Drake Maye completed 14-of-20 passes for 150 yards in the first half but threw an interception post-halftime.

title: Braintree man dies weeks after being struck by e-bike in Copley Square
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Minh Dang, 64, from Braintree died after being struck by an e-bike in Copley Square last month.
The incident occurred on August 6 outside the Boston Public Library near Huntington Avenue and Dartmouth Street.
The e-bike operator stayed at the scene; no charges have been filed, according to Boston police.

title: Watch out for the ‘wicked high’ king tides this week at Boston Harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Boston Harbor will experience 'king tides' or perigean spring tides, this fall due to the moon's orbit and phases.
These tides occur when the moon is at perigee, aligning with a new or full moon, raising tides 2-4 feet.
Events related to these tides will take place at Long Wharf, with several scheduled dates from September to December.

title: Stefon Diggs says Drake Maye isn’t a ‘softie’ when it comes to criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs supports Drake Maye's ability to handle criticism after Patriots' loss to the Raiders.
Drake Maye struggled in the second half against the Raiders, completing 7-of-12 passes for 51 yards.
Stefon Diggs debuted with six catches for 57 yards against the Raiders, reflecting on his comeback post-ACL injury.

title: Audit: K-12 school department failed to investigate 22 child abuse reports
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: State audit finds DESE failed to investigate 22 supported child abuse reports due to communication issues with DCF.
Audit reveals DESE delays in resolving special education complaints and issuing corrective action plans, impacting student support.
DESE criticized for not providing adequate LGBTQ training and materials to school districts, affecting supportive environments.

title: ‘Nothing short of horrific’: Mass. politicians react to fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk was fatally shot during a political event at Utah Valley University.
Massachusetts politicians, including Gov. Maura Healey and Sen. Elizabeth Warren, condemned the political violence.
Authorities arrested and released a suspect, with FBI stating only one person was involved in the shooting.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez not practicing, along with 2 key vets
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Christian Gonzalez remains out with a hamstring injury and has not practiced since July 28.
Harold Landry and Morgan Moses also missed practice, with Landry dealing with a foot injury.
Receiver Kayshon Boutte was limited at practice due to a shoulder injury but was a key player in Week 1.

title: Drake Maye talks starting fast, capitalizing in the red zone, and the throws he wished he had back
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Drake Maye completed 30 of 46 passes for 287 yards with a touchdown in the Patriots' loss to the Raiders.
Maye acknowledged rushing some throws, including an interception that disrupted New England's third-quarter drive.
Patriots struggled in the red zone, converting only 1 of 3 opportunities, while the Raiders scored on their lone chance.
